title: In the Western Highlands of Scotland, and holiday notes at Scarborough
author: Cowley, Percy Tunnicliff.
snippet: Then home to the " Central" and to bed, where I was lulled to sleep with the bronchial hissing of an engine. Next morning, breakfast over, I had a stroll round, and viewed the new Municipal Buildings and the Cathedral. The buildings all round are certainly very fine and massive, but the City itself is, like all great Mercantile Cities, smoke, dirt, and bustle.

title: Rambles with an American,
author: [Jacques, Edward Tyrell]
snippet: I am afraid to say upon what storey of the Municipal Buildings in the Eoyal Exchange the museum of civic curiosities and relics is situate. The stairs that lead up to it are as the sands of the sea in multitude ; but when once the ascent to that heaven-kissing room has been accomplished, no lover of the by-ways of history can say that he has journeyed in vain.

title: Rambles with an American,
author: [Jacques, Edward Tyrell]
snippet: We turned westward when we left the Municipal Buildings. Mr. Fairfield moved on lagging feet, and paused at every close-head to take what might be a

title: Edinburgh,
author: Masson, Rosaline Orme.
snippet: They go into St. Giles's Church, and are told the lively tale of Jenny Geddes and her militant tactics, and divide their attention between her and the tombs of Montrose and Moray and Argyle. They peep into Parliament House, and into the Parliament Hall, empty if the Courts have " risen," — they cross to the Municipal Buildings, and see some of the signs of our luxurious civic life, and they discover the museum there. If they have time they go also to see the University and the McEwan Hall, and the Public Library.
